intro: Lisianthius trifidus, commonly known as the three-lobed lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often growing in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
